data.title: FINLAND HOLIDAY COTTAGES
data.meta_description: Finland holiday cottages. Price from 75€/night. Cottages to rent in Finland: LakeLand - Lapland - Helsinki.
data.text:
HOW TO RENT A HOLIDAY COTTAGE IN FINLAND

1. START CHOOSING A COTTAGE WELL IN ADVANCE

We recommend to book a cottage in Finland for summer vacations or Christmas breaks at least 6 months before the holidays. Dates between 15 July - 15 August (summer), 20 December - 14 January (Christmas and New Year) are in high demand. Best value holiday cottages can be booked year in advance.

2. SELECT DATES OF YOUR TRAVEL

Good to know about rental cottages in Finland:

* weekend rentals: from Friday to Saturday - 2 nights;

* cottage rentals during summer (June - August): 80% of holidays cottages available for weekly rental only with changing day on a Saturday, less often on Fridays or Sundays; outside the high season other changeover day is possible.

* Christmas and New Year rentals: Lapland cabins and ski resorts cottages have changeover day on Saturday or Sunday and min rental period is 1 week. Cottages in other area of Finland are more flexible. Usually cottage owners try to rent 23-26.12, 28.12 - 4.01.;

* сheck-in time is usually 16.00; check-out time is usually 12.00. When renting for the weekend, departure can be on Sunday evening.

If your travel dates are flexible, send us a request. We'll send you a list of cottages according to your needs and requirements.

3. SPECIFY COTTAGE REQUIRMENTS

* cottage location, or max distance from Helsinki;

* number of guests - adults and kids; sometimes the cottage price can vary from number of guests or the age of children;

* sleeps requirements: how many bed-rooms do you need;

* price limits;

* what you want to do during cottages holidays in Finland.

99% holiday cottages in Finland are located lakeside / riverside by the water.

All cottages have sauna - inside or separate wood-heated shore sauna.

4. CHOOSE THE MOST SUITABLE COTTAGE

We try to provide as much information about the cottage as possible. Cottage description contains photos and video, location on map, list of facilities and equipment. If you need more information to take a decision, ask us.

If you have special requirements or need an advice, send us a request by email. We will tell the pros and cons of the selected houses.

5. BOOK THE COTTAGE

When you have found the suitable holiday cottage, book it!

You'll get confirmation, exact property address and driving instructions, cottage owner contact details, terms of rent, final cleaning rules. Please note that your booking is not confirmed until you have got the booking confirmation by email.

Please read the documents carefully and follow the booking instructions. If you need more information about the cottage, route, etc, ask us before payment.

6. PAY IT

80% of holiday cottages in Finland has general rules for payment:

* Summer and Christmas-New Year rentals - a deposit of 30-50% will be charged in a week after the booking; the remaining balance will be due 4-6 weeks prior to the start of the cottage holidays.

* Low season or weekend/short break rentals: a deposit of 10-30% will be charged at the time of the booking. Remaining balance can be paid with cash.

We accept payment by bank cards as well as bank transfer.

7. GET BOOKING CONFIRMATION AND START HOLIDAY PREPARATION

\
